verses.verse: (Godâ€™s Power and Justice) To the leader: according to Muth-labben. A Psalm of David. (Ps 26.7; 86.12) (Psalms 9-10 were originally one psalm, as in the Greek and Latin traditions. In Hebrew, Psalms 9-10 formed an acrostic.) I will give thanks to the LORD with my whole heart; I will tell of all your wonderful deeds.
(Ps 5.11; 83.18) I will be glad and exult in you; I will sing praise to your name, O Most High.
(Ps 27.2; 56.9) When my enemies turned back, they stumbled and perished before you.
(Ps 47.8; 67.4; 140.12; 1 Pet 2.23) For you have maintained my just cause; you have sat on the throne giving righteous judgment.
(Deut 9.14) You have rebuked the nations; you have destroyed the wicked; you have blotted out their name forever and ever.
(Ps 34.16; 40.15) The enemies have vanished in everlasting ruins; their cities you have rooted out; the very memory of them has perished.
(Ps 29.10; 89.14) But the LORD sits enthroned forever; he has established his throne for judgment.
(Ps 96.13) He judges the world with righteousness; he judges the peoples with equity.
(Ps 18.2; 32.7; 37.39) The LORD is a stronghold for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of trouble.
(Ps 37.28; 91.14) And those who know your name put their trust in you, for you, O LORD, have not forsaken those who seek you.
(Ps 76.2; 105.1) Sing praises to the LORD, who dwells in Zion. Declare his deeds among the peoples.
(v 18|PSA 9:18; Gen 9.5) For he who avenges blood is mindful of them; he does not forget the cry of the afflicted.
(Ps 25.19; 30.3, 10; 38.19) Be gracious to me, O LORD. See what I suffer from those who hate me; you are the one who lifts me up from the gates of death,
(Ps 13.5; 87.2; 106.2) so that I may recount all your praises and, in the gates of daughter Zion, rejoice in your deliverance.
(Ps 7.15; 35.8) The nations have sunk in the pit that they made; in the net that they hid has their own foot been caught.
(v 4|PSA 9:4; Isa 64.2) The LORD has made himself known; he has executed judgment; the wicked are snared in the work of their own hands. Higgaion. Selah
(Job 8.13; Ps 49.14; 50.22) The wicked shall depart to Sheol, all the nations that forget God.
(v 12|PSA 9:12; Ps 74.19) For the needy shall not always be forgotten, nor the hope of the poor perish forever.
(2 Chr 14.11; Ps 3.7; 110.6) Rise up, O LORD! Do not let mortals prevail; let the nations be judged before you.
(Ps 83.15; Isa 31.3) Put them in fear, O LORD; let the nations know that they are only human. Selah
